strIntroduction: Explore the southeast of Mauritius in this island getaway on speedboat Snorkel the lively and colorful seabed of Blue Bay Visit the historic Fouquets Island (Lighthouse Island) Head out to Grand River Southeast and take a mini boat ride to get closer to the waterfalls Enjoy a delicious barbecue lunch of lobster or giant prawns on the island paradise, Ile aux Cerfs Lounge and bask on the island for the rest of the afternoon Snorkel the lively and colorful seabed of Blue Bay Snorkel the lively and colorful seabed of Blue Bay Visit the historic Fouquets Island (Lighthouse Island) Visit the historic Fouquets Island (Lighthouse Island) Head out to Grand River Southeast and take a mini boat ride to get closer to the waterfalls Head out to Grand River Southeast and take a mini boat ride to get closer to the waterfalls Enjoy a delicious barbecue lunch of lobster or giant prawns on the island paradise, Ile aux Cerfs Enjoy a delicious barbecue lunch of lobster or giant prawns on the island paradise, Ile aux Cerfs Lounge and bask on the island for the rest of the afternoon Lounge and bask on the island for the rest of the afternoon What We Love:   What We Love: Embark on a fun-packed speedboat trip around the southeast of Mauritius, beginning with a snorkeling trip in the azure paradise of Blue Bay. Loved as a haven for watersports, you'll be captivated by the lively seabed that awaits, with coral life in full color amidst clear waters. From there, you're bound for the historic Fouquets Island (or Lighthouse Island), then to the Grand River Southeast, where you'll be treated to a mini boat trip bringing you closer to the waterfalls. Head then to Ile aux Cerfs, a white sand gem in the middle of the ocean, and enjoy a freshly prepared lunch of barbecue lobster or giant prawns – your choice, although you may indicate any dietary requirements if needed – before spending a day lounging on, and getting to know, the island itself.
strTitle: Speedboat to Blue Bay & Ile aux Cerfs

strIntroduction: Go for a swim and snorkel through the pristine blue waters of Gabriel Island and the neighboring Flat Island Head northward of Mauritius towards Ilot Gabriel (Gabriel Island) and Ilot Plate (Flat Island), two immaculate slices of paradise set in the middle of the water Go swimming and snorkeling in crystal blue waters, and get up close to the lively marine life Indulge in a delicious barbecue lunch aboard the catamaran Head northward of Mauritius towards Ilot Gabriel (Gabriel Island) and Ilot Plate (Flat Island), two immaculate slices of paradise set in the middle of the water Head northward of Mauritius towards Ilot Gabriel (Gabriel Island) and Ilot Plate (Flat Island), two immaculate slices of paradise set in the middle of the water Go swimming and snorkeling in crystal blue waters, and get up close to the lively marine life Go swimming and snorkeling in crystal blue waters, and get up close to the lively marine life Indulge in a delicious barbecue lunch aboard the catamaran Indulge in a delicious barbecue lunch aboard the catamaran What We Love:   What We Love: Venture toward the extreme north of Mauritius on a catamaran, toward Ilot Gabriel – also known as Gabriel Island. It's a beautiful, protected natural reserve rich with untouched beaches – a marvel to behold and enjoy with family, or a loved one. You'll also get to visit the nearby Ilot Plate, or Flat Island, an impeccably pristine slice of land in the middle of the water. From snorkel dips between trips and wandering among colorful marine life, to swimming in dazzling emerald waters and taking in the picturesque horizons from your luxury boat, you're guaranteed, no doubt, one of the most laidback and leisurely journeys you'll ever make on the island.

Hop aboard a speedboat, swim with dolphins, and see Mauritius' breathtaking islands, including Ile aux Bénitiers Go on a two-hour swim with dolphins – in their very own turf! Snorkel the lively, underwater world of Mauritius' west coast Glimpse the beautiful rock gem in the middle of the ocean: Le Morne Crystal Rock Enjoy a savory barbecue lunch at the Island of Bénitiers Spend a lovely beach afternoon on Bénitiers – dip into clear, cool waters and take in breathtaking views of Le Morne Mountain Go on a two-hour swim with dolphins – in their very own turf! Go on a two-hour swim with dolphins – in their very own turf! Snorkel the lively, underwater world of Mauritius' west coast Snorkel the lively, underwater world of Mauritius' west coast Glimpse the beautiful rock gem in the middle of the ocean: Le Morne Crystal Rock Glimpse the beautiful rock gem in the middle of the ocean: Le Morne Crystal Rock Enjoy a savory barbecue lunch at the Island of Bénitiers Enjoy a savory barbecue lunch at the Island of Bénitiers Spend a lovely beach afternoon on Bénitiers – dip into clear, cool waters and take in breathtaking views of Le Morne Mountain Spend a lovely beach afternoon on Bénitiers – dip into clear, cool waters and take in breathtaking views of Le Morne Mountain What We Love:   What We Love: Hang out with aquamarine creatures and venture off into an island paradise in this day cruise. You'll be invited to dip into dolphin turf for some two hours, and swim with the friendly marine animals in the clear waters of Mauritius. There'll also be room for snorkeling, so keep your eyes open for the colorful world that awaits under water! From there it's back aboard a luxury speedboat, where you'll glimpse Le Morne Crystal Rock – a beautiful rock gem in the middle of the ocean – en route to Ile aux Bénitiers (Bénitiers Island), an island off the west coast. Indulge in a sumptuous barbecue lunch, and make the most of your stay by roaming the island before hopping back aboard, and sailing toward the afternoon's end.

Spend half a day at Mauritius' favorite nature & leisure park! Explore the park with an exciting quadbike ride Walk with lions and cheetahs – and stick around for a photo op or two! Meet and greet the park's zebras, deer, and giant tortoises on open grounds Explore the park with an exciting quadbike ride Explore the park with an exciting quadbike ride Walk with lions and cheetahs – and stick around for a photo op or two! Walk with lions and cheetahs – and stick around for a photo op or two! Meet and greet the park's zebras, deer, and giant tortoises on open grounds Meet and greet the park's zebras, deer, and giant tortoises on open grounds What We Love:   What We Love: At Mauritius' Casela Nature and Leisure Park, visitors are given wide-open freedom to enjoy the island's incredible natural gifts. In this day tour, get a taste of the park's best sights in a single, fuss-free journey. Enjoy an exciting quadbike ride across 14 hectares of greenery, greeting free-roaming wildlife: zebras, monkeys, peacocks, deer, and the incredible giant tortoises. A once-in-a-lifetime experience also awaits, where you'll get the chance to walk with lions and cheetahs – nowhere else in the world will you be able to snap intimate selfies with these wildcats!

The boat is also fully furnished with a toilet and shower Be surrounded by generous views of Mauritius' breathtaking mountains and seascapes Enjoy full privacy with a 40ft boat rented out exclusively for your group – and the full service of experienced boat crew and anglers Enjoy full privacy with a 40ft boat rented out exclusively for your group – and the full service of experienced boat crew and anglers Be guided by experts, or demonstrate your own angling skills to score a catch in the rich waters of Mauritius Be guided by experts, or demonstrate your own angling skills to score a catch in the rich waters of Mauritius Ready yourself for a catch from the deep – the west coast seabed drops past 3,000m, making it home to a diversity of ocean species Ready yourself for a catch from the deep – the west coast seabed drops past 3,000m, making it home to a diversity of ocean species Replenish with complementary snacks and drinks onboard. The boat is also fully furnished with a toilet and shower Be surrounded by generous views of Mauritius' breathtaking mountains and seascapes Be surrounded by generous views of Mauritius' breathtaking mountains and seascapes What We Love:   What We Love: Hop aboard a fishing boat for a full day of adventure (half-day option also available). Known as a local favorite pastime – and for its record-breaking game! – big game fishing or deep sea fishing in Mauritius is an esteemed activity, drawing fishermen and enthusiasts of the sport from around the world. Try a hand at angling for the chance to score the revered blue marlin, a massive creature known to fight against being drawn up from the water! Or sink a hook for a black marlin instead, a tuna, or a mako shark. With an experienced crew on board to make every leg of the fishing trip worthwhile, you're bound for a uniquely Mauritian afternoon!

Go on an underwater adventure – on foot! Enjoy a guided tour of the sandy lagoon bottom of Grand Baie – a journey made entirely on foot, with a solar-powered breathing helmet! Get up close and personal with colorful fish and coral in the guided, 25mins underwater walk Get an introductory and safety briefing before making the descent Trivia: All gear and machine involved in this activity remain Mauritius' only solar-powered – and environmentally friendly! – units Rest secure in the operator's full safety gear and equipment, as well as their 13+ years of experience Enjoy a guided tour of the sandy lagoon bottom of Grand Baie – a journey made entirely on foot, with a solar-powered breathing helmet! Get up close and personal with colorful fish and coral in the guided, 25mins underwater walk Get up close and personal with colorful fish and coral in the guided, 25mins underwater walk Get an introductory and safety briefing before making the descent Get an introductory and safety briefing before making the descent Trivia: All gear and machine involved in this activity remain Mauritius' only solar-powered – and environmentally friendly! – units Trivia: All gear and machine involved in this activity remain Mauritius' only solar-powered – and environmentally friendly! – units Rest secure in the operator's full safety gear and equipment, as well as their 13+ years of experience Rest secure in the operator's full safety gear and equipment, as well as their 13+ years of experience What We Love:   What We Love: Here's a way to explore the sandy seabed of Mauritius on foot! The Solar Undersea Walk takes you to the bottom of the ocean with a helmet that lets you breathe, see through distortion-free panels, and keep both your hair and glasses (if you wear a pair!) dry. Descend three to four meters deep into the water, where a guide will take you around the lively underwater neighborhood. Meet and greet the resident fish, in all colors and stripes, and rub shoulders with the vibrant coral, as a constant flow of fresh air supplies your oxygen helmet. Because you'll be walking, no swimming knowledge is at all required. Trivia: over 50% of the operator's clients have been non-swimmers!

Sail aboard a glass-bottom boat and snorkel the beautiful water world of Blue Bay Marine Park! Experience the wondrous blue waters of Blue Bay Marine Park, truly a gem of nature South East of Mauritius Hop aboard a glass-bottom boat for beautiful blue views of the ocean underneath Plunge into crystal clear waters for a swim, and snorkel the diverse marine world deep below See over 50 species of coral, and rub shoulders with Trumpet fish, Butterfly fish, Damselfish and countless more Experience the wondrous blue waters of Blue Bay Marine Park, truly a gem of nature South East of Mauritius Experience the wondrous blue waters of Blue Bay Marine Park, truly a gem of nature South East of Mauritius Hop aboard a glass-bottom boat for beautiful blue views of the ocean underneath Hop aboard a glass-bottom boat for beautiful blue views of the ocean underneath Plunge into crystal clear waters for a swim, and snorkel the diverse marine world deep below Plunge into crystal clear waters for a swim, and snorkel the diverse marine world deep below See over 50 species of coral, and rub shoulders with Trumpet fish, Butterfly fish, Damselfish and countless more See over 50 species of coral, and rub shoulders with Trumpet fish, Butterfly fish, Damselfish and countless more What We Love:   What We Love: Experience the turquoise waters of Mauritius' Blue Bay Marine Park in this boat and snorkeling trip. As though you couldn't get enough of the blue, you'll have the chance to sail aboard a glass-bottom boat, and be blessed with crystal clear views of the water underneath. Plus, while you can stay dry for the rest of the trip, we reckon it better to take the plunge – what's a vacation in Mauritius for? Swim through the beautiful turquoise gem, and venture deeper for a snorkel amongst colorful sea life, from mangroves to coral, and fish countless different kinds. With depths of up to 5.5m, a whole new world awaits your descent.

Explore the deep blue waters of Trou aux Biches with a diving course for beginners or a certified divers experience Venture deep into the clear azure waters of the Indian Ocean Learn to scuba dive with this introductory course and experience, tailored for beginners Swim alongside fish and various other sea creatures, as well as beautiful coral reef Take comfort in top notch scuba diving gear and equipment, as well as full safety operations assured by the operator Venture deep into the clear azure waters of the Indian Ocean Venture deep into the clear azure waters of the Indian Ocean Learn to scuba dive with this introductory course and experience, tailored for beginners Learn to scuba dive with this introductory course and experience, tailored for beginners Swim alongside fish and various other sea creatures, as well as beautiful coral reef Swim alongside fish and various other sea creatures, as well as beautiful coral reef Take comfort in top notch scuba diving gear and equipment, as well as full safety operations assured by the operator Take comfort in top notch scuba diving gear and equipment, as well as full safety operations assured by the operator What We Love:   What We Love: Make your way to the laidback beaches of Trou aux Biches, where you'll venture out on a boat before plunging into the waters for a dive. From here, it's an exploration of wonders under the sea, from coral full of color, to fish and other sea creatures full of life. Non-divers need not worry, as the scuba dives are tailored for both beginners and PADI-certified swimmers, inclusive of necessary lectures and orientations, as well as full gear and safety equipment. With the dive taking you farther to discover the ocean gems of Mauritius, the experience is sure to etch itself equally deeply in your memory.
strTitle: Trou aux Biches Scuba Diving Adventure

strIntroduction: Get to the bottom of the ocean without ever getting wet – in this submarine ride! Explore the clear blue waters of the Indian Ocean in these underwater capsules, perfect for an extraordinary experience of the world under the sea. Glimpse colorful fish and other marine creatures through your distortion-free glass as they glide slowly past, and see the intriguing remnants of an old shipwreck. Easy to control and quick to get the hang of, the Subscooter is part-underwater taxi, part-submarine, making for an out-of-the-box ride around the Grand Bay seabed! Receive a quick, 15-minute orientation before getting into your wetsuit and piloting your own ‘vehicle.' Then, it's an approx. 30-meter descent to the bottom of the sea – which you'll spend a whole half-hour exploring! Breathe freely as you make your way around the sandy ocean bottom, following the lead of your underwater guide, and glimpse spectacular views of ocean life through the capsule's panoramic glass.

What We Love:   What We Love: A small island in the Indian Ocean, Mauritius is relatively easy to traverse. For travelers, however, it is said that the best way to get around is to hail a taxi, or drive. Why not hire a car instead and spare yourself any peripheral trouble? With a driver of your own for a whole eight hours, you're set for the day's itinerary. Select from one of two rental rides: a car for parties of four, or a van for groups of up to 13, and you're ready for a memorable, trouble-free stay.

Spend one whole day at the Malay mainland with thrilling outdoor activities Plan your own adventure with many activities to choose from - river tubing, waterfall exploration or a cave tour Feast on a delicious BBQ lunch served in a peaceful jungle garden setting Enjoy a special riverside bonfire and travel back to Boracay at sunset Plan your own adventure with many activities to choose from - river tubing, waterfall exploration or a cave tour Feast on a delicious BBQ lunch served in a peaceful jungle garden setting Enjoy a special riverside bonfire and travel back to Boracay at sunset What We Love:   What We Love: Explore a different side to the popular beach destination of Boracay at a local eco park that offers a host of outdoor adventures - river trekking, caving and wild river tubing to name a few! A whole day nature experience, you are free to plan your own adventure so lounge by the Nabaoy river or rent a mountain bike to explore the land. Take a sip of 'tuba', the local coconut wine, if you're feeling adventurous. Indulge in a delicious Filipino style BBQ lunch at a tropical jungle garden and relax around a riverside bonfire before returning to Boracay at sunset.

When the boat stops at various scenic points throughout the day, you can take a dip in the ocean or snorkel to your heart's content. The boat trip also includes a visit to Magic Island for a cliff diving experience or the popular Crystal Cove with local artefacts on display.

Then, enjoy an amazing view of the island as you are brought back to the starting point on Boracay's newest flying cable car.

You're going to want your camera with you - you don't want to miss out on capturing this island paradise from the air!

strIntroduction: INSTANTBook now and get your e-ticket instantly INSTANT  Book now and get your e-ticket instantly Enjoy the day outdoors cliff diving, snorkelling, kayaking or sun bathing at the world famous Ariel's Point in the Philippines Test your bravery with nine different diving boards and platforms ranging from 3 meters to 15 meters Enjoy a wide variety of outdoor activities including kayaking (single or tandem kayaks), snorkelling and stand up paddle boarding Ride on a traditional Filipino outrigger boat to and from Ariel's Point Have a delicious BBQ lunch buffet along with unlimited drinks on the day Your safety is paramount - lifeguards are present throughout the day Test your bravery with nine different diving boards and platforms ranging from 3 meters to 15 meters Enjoy a wide variety of outdoor activities including kayaking (single or tandem kayaks), snorkelling and stand up paddle boarding Ride on a traditional Filipino outrigger boat to and from Ariel's Point Have a delicious BBQ lunch buffet along with unlimited drinks on the day Your safety is paramount - lifeguards are present throughout the day What We Love:   What We Love: Take a leap of faith and plunge into the beautiful waters of Boracay at one of the world's top cliff diving destinations. Located on the edge of a fishing village, Ariel's Point boasts lush tropical forests, clear turquoise waters, abundant marine life and volcanic rock formations. The party starts the minute you step aboard the traditional Filipino 'banca' boat. Sip on the unlimited drinks available then decide if you want to spend your time cliff diving, kayaking, snorkelling, open water swimming or lounging - tailor your day in paradise with the wide variety of activities. Replenish yourself after a physical morning with a lunch buffet includes fresh and traditional delicacies.

Enjoy a fun-filled ride on an inflatable raft on a beautiful Boracay beach: fly through the waves, hold on tight and get your fresh dose of adrenaline! Hop on an exciting water ride with Flyfish Boracay Rip through the waves as your raft is pulled by a speedboat and feel a true adrenaline rush Wind in your hair, drops of seawater on your face and laughter all around – Flyfish Boracay is a great experience for the whole family Flyfish is exciting and safe: wear a life jacket, try to hold on and have fun in the water if you don't! Hop on an exciting water ride with Flyfish Boracay Rip through the waves as your raft is pulled by a speedboat and feel a true adrenaline rush Wind in your hair, drops of seawater on your face and laughter all around – Flyfish Boracay is a great experience for the whole family Flyfish is exciting and safe: wear a life jacket, try to hold on and have fun in the water if you don't! What We Love:   What We Love: Go on an exciting full-filled water ride in Boracay – Flyfish! Flyfish is an inflatable raft, similar to Banana Boat that is pulled along by a speedboat. As the boat starts going faster, your Flyfish will lift up, turn sideways, glide and shake – and you will have lots of fun trying to hold on to stay on top – and even more fun if you fall off. Don't worry – Flyfish is safe and you will be wearing a life jacket throughout the whole ride. Flyfish in Boracay is a fun and adventurous water activity for the whole family or a group of friends. Head over to the beach and hop on the yellow raft for a thrilling experience on the water!

Set sail for adventure with paraw sailing in Boracay: an exciting water activity to enjoy with a group of friends! Try out one of the must-do Boracay activities – Paraw sailing – on the clear blue waters of the Sulu Sea Discover the island on a traditional local sail boat made of wood and bamboo Relax and take in stunning tropical views as you glide along Boracay on the island's signature boat Bring your friends along – the boat can hold from 4 to 6 people – and this is an experience you'd want to share! Try out one of the must-do Boracay activities – Paraw sailing – on the clear blue waters of the Sulu Sea Try out one of the must-do Boracay activities – Paraw sailing – on the clear blue waters of the Sulu Sea Discover the island on a traditional local sail boat made of wood and bamboo Discover the island on a traditional local sail boat made of wood and bamboo Relax and take in stunning tropical views as you glide along Boracay on the island's signature boat Relax and take in stunning tropical views as you glide along Boracay on the island's signature boat Bring your friends along – the boat can hold from 4 to 6 people – and this is an experience you'd want to share! Bring your friends along – the boat can hold from 4 to 6 people – and this is an experience you'd want to share! What We Love:   What We Love: A paraw is a small traditional boat with two outriggers sailed in the Philippines. Many believe paraw sailing to be an essential activity to put on their "things to do in Boracay" list. Why? The boat itself is worthy of admiration. A single shallow hull, made of wood and bamboo and adorned by a large sail, it needs two floaters or logs on each side to keep the balance. This sailing adventure is a rich cultural experience and loads of fun. Discover the beautiful Boracay island as you glide on crystal-clear turquoise waters with a fresh sea breeze. A paraw can accommodate 4 to 6 people, so bring some friends along to share your Boracay adventure!

Late in the afternoon, drive to visit Wenshu Buddhist Temple, which was built during the Tang Dynasty. This temple is the largest and best preserved Buddhist temple in the province of Sichuan. When the fun is over, your guide and driver will transfer you back to your Chengdu hotel before dinner. The perfect one day private sightseeing tour of Chengdu city!
